thread.title: Maple Leafs-Pittsburgh Penguins: Game preview
thread.title_full: Maple Leafs-Pittsburgh Penguins: Game preview | Toronto Star

author: Kevin McGran
title: Maple Leafs-Pittsburgh Penguins: Game preview
text:
CONSOL ENERGY ARENA
Puck drop: 7 p.m.
TV: CBC
Radio: Sportsnet 590 The Fan
Key matchup: Dion Phaneuf vs. Phil Kessel. It’s the first time the two good friends will play against each other. Phaneuf always draws the tough assignments and generally plays well against Sidney Crosby. This time, Crosby has the help of a pure scorer in Kessel on his right side.
Need to know: Daniel Sprong, an 18-year-old second-round pick in June’s draft, scored his first goal on Thursday . . . Crosby is still looking for his first point of the season . . . Forward Beau Bennett, Pittsburgh’s top producer in the pre-season, is out with an undisclosed injury.
Up Next: Wednesday at Buffalo, 7 p.m., Sportsnet

Plenty at stake as Toronto FC hosts Columbus Crew
